roleset.name: to amuse or charm
roleset.note: BEGUILE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'beguile' based on internet usage examples, membership in VN. Verbnet entry 31.1, comparison with 'amuse,' 'cheat.' (from beguile.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: Transitive, all arguments
example.text: John beguiled Mary with juggling tricks.

example.name: Pass time pleasantly
example.text: Mary beguiled her days with reading.

roleset.name: deprive, cheat someone out of something
roleset.note: BEGUILE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'beguile' based on internet usage examples, membership in VN. Verbnet entry 31.1, comparison with 'amuse,' 'cheat.' (from beguile.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary beguiled John of his money.

roleset.name: deceive
roleset.note: BEGUILE-V NOTES: Frame by Claire (from beguile.03-v)

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Mary beguiled John about the location of the money.
example.arg: about the location of the money
